title: Health Ministry still following Keheliya method in medicine procurement: FLSP
byline: The Front Line Socialist Party (FLSP) yesterday alleged that the current government is continuing the old practice of procuring substandard medicines at higher prices.

title: Don’t self-medicate for mosquito borne illnesses, warn experts
byline: In the wake of the rising cases of mosquito-borne illnesses and regular viral fever, health authorities urge the public to visit a doctor if they have fever that lasts more than two days.

title: Elon Musk’s Starbase in Texas will officially become a city
byline: The area where Elon Musk’s SpaceX company operates on the southern tip of Texas is to officially become a city called Starbase.

title: Over 70,000 Police deployed ahead of LG polls tomorrow
byline: More than 70,000 police personnel have been deployed across Sri Lanka to ensure a safe, fair, and orderly voting process during the Local Government (LG) elections scheduled for tomorrow.

title: From peons to Additional Ministry Secretaries will perform duties in tomorrow’s LG polls
byline: A total cadre of 250, 000 government servants ranging from office assistants, clerks and even up to Additional Secretaries of ministries will be deployed to perform various duties pertaining to tomorrow’s Local Government elections to be held countrywide for 339 local bodies, an official said.

title: Eta Aquarids meteor shower peak on May 6, visible till May 27
byline: The Eta Aquarids meteor shower will reach its peak tomorrow (6) and remain visible till May 27, the Astronomy Division of the Arthur C. Clarke Institute for Modern Technologies said.

title: Trump says non-US movies to be hit with 100% tariffs
byline: US President Donald Trump says he will hit movies made in foreign countries with 100% tariffs, as he ramps up trade disputes with nations around the world.

title: Assailant slaps Turkish main opposition leader Özel
byline: An assailant slapped Özgür Özel, leader of the main opposition Republican People’s Party (CHP), on Sunday as he was leaving an event in Istanbul.

title: Youth killed in Mount Lavinia shooting
byline: A 19-year-old youth was shot dead in a gun attack on Beach Road, Mount Lavinia, this morning, police said.

title: Trump says he is not considering running for third term
byline: US President Donald Trump has denied that he is considering running for a third presidential term, a move which experts agree is banned under the US Constitution.

title: Maldives president holds record 15-hour press conference
byline: Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu addressed a press conference for nearly 15 hours, his office said on Sunday, claiming it broke a previous record held by Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: Air India suspends flights to Tel Aviv to May 6 after airport attack
byline: Air India said on Sunday it had suspended flights to Tel Aviv until May 6 after a missile attack on Israel’s main international airport.

title: SLTB officers remanded for soliciting bribe
byline: Two officials attached to the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) Eastern Province Regional Office were remanded till May 9, by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali today over allegations of soliciting a bribe of Rs. 100,000 to influence a disciplinary inquiry.

title: SL Customs to publicise names of tax defaulters, other offenders from June 1st
byline: Sri Lanka Customs will publicise the names and particulars of individuals and companies defaulting taxes, seized smugglers and those who intentionally violate the Customs Ordinance on its official web portal from June 1st.

title: 15 Sri Lankans trapped in Myanmar cyber camps to be rescued
byline: Fifteen Sri Lankans who have been trapped in cybercrime centres in Myawaddy, Myanmar, are set to be rescued tomorrow, according to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism.

title: President invites Vietnam’s Vingroup to invest in Sri Lanka
byline: President Anura Kumara Disanayake, who is currently on a state visit to Vietnam, extended an open invitation to Vietnam’s leading conglomerate, Vingroup, to explore investment opportunities in Sri Lanka’s real estate and tourism sectors.

title: Trump orders reopening of Alcatraz prison
byline: US President Donald Trump said on Sunday (May 4) he was directing the Federal Bureau of Prisons to rebuild and reopen the infamous Alcatraz prison in the San Francisco Bay to ’’house America’s most ruthless and violent Offenders.’’

title: Industry urges Health Minister to halt proposed G2G pharma imports
byline: Three leading pharmaceutical associations in Sri Lanka have called on Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa to immediately halt the proposed government-to-government (G2G) pharmaceutical import initiative as it could jeopardise patient safety, cripple local manufacturing, and open doors to corruption.

title: E-commerce spending via cards surge by 27.4% in 2024
byline: E-commerce transactions via card payments in Sri Lanka witnessed robust growth of 27.4 percent YoY valuing at Rs.367.6 billion in 2024,

title: 9 killed after 4 tourist boats capsize in China, state media reports
byline: Nine people died when ’’sudden strong winds’’ capsized four tourist boats and plunged 84 people into the water in Southwestern China, state media reported on Monday (May 5).

title: No arrests yet in Rs. 4.5 M Swiss envoy theft case
byline: The Kollupitiya Police are yet to make a breakthrough in the theft at the official residence of the Swiss Ambassador, where gold jewellery—including a diamond-studded ring—and luxury wristwatches worth approximately Rs. 4.5 million were reported stolen from a safe.

title: Sri Lanka nears 900,000 tourist arrivals
byline: Sri Lanka’s tourism sector is nearing the 900,000 arrival mark for the year, with 896,884 tourists recorded by the end of April 2025.

title: Almost one in three new tourists in SL from India
byline: Indian tourists are driving growth in Sri Lanka’s tourism sector, accounting for nearly one-third of all new arrivals in the first four months of the year, according to data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA).

title: Stray dog capture gang sparks meat trade fears
byline: An organized gang capturing stray dogs in villages around the Moragahakanda reservoir and along the Elahera road has raised serious concerns among local residents, who suspect the animals are being slaughtered for meat.

title: Sri Lanka’s ‘Knights’ wins runners-up at International Music contest in India
byline: Sri Lankan musical group ’Knights’ has secured the runner-up position at the ’Battle of the Bands – International’ competition held in Mumbai, India.

title: Vietnamese, Sri Lankan Presidents seek $1 bn in trade
byline: Vietnam President Lương Cường on Monday held talks with Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayaka after hosting an official welcome ceremony at the Presidential Palace in Hà Nội.

title: Over 96,000 foreigners donate eye corneas this year
byline: A total of 96,000 foreign nationals have contributed eye corneas so far this year, with the majority of donations going to Egypt, followed by Lebanon, Pakistan, Iraq, Kenya, and 56 other countries, the Sri Lanka Eye Donation Society (SLEDS) announced.

title: Bangladesh to tour Sri Lanka for bilateral cricket series in June–July
byline: The Bangladesh National Men’s Cricket Team will tour Sri Lanka in June and July 2025 for a bilateral series comprising Tests, ODIs, and T20Is.

title: Severe lightning warning for six districts
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a severe lightning warning for six districts, effective until 11:00 p.m. today.

title: Krrish Tower issued red notice over dengue threat
byline: Colombo’s Krrish Tower has been issued a red notice after health officials found it posed a serious dengue risk during a routine inspection.

title: Sri Lanka soar in ODIs and T20Is rankings with home dominance
byline: Australia remains at the top in Tests, India leads the two white-ball formats, while Sri Lanka emerge big winners as the yearly ICC rankings refresh brings big movements across formats.

title: Former Agriculture Ministry Additional Secretary granted bail
byline: The former Additional Secretary of the Ministry of Agriculture and former Chief Secretary of the Uva Province Mahesh Lasantha Gammanpila, was released on bail today over the allegation of causing a loss of over Rs. 13 million to the government by importing a shipment of organic fertilizer contaminated with harmful bacteria and pathogens.

title: Watch out for Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith: International media expert
byline: While highlighting that the Catholic Church might look towards the East to find a successor to late Pope Francis, an analyst and media expert on religious affairs said one should watch out for Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith.

title: Bribed money outweighs earnings for Govt. from court fines, compensations
byline: The government has earned Rs.462,000 in terms of fines and compensation over bribery cases during the first quarter of this year, but the value of bribed money far outweighs it, totalling Rs.6.5 million, according to data published by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: BASL calls for zero-tolerance policy on ragging
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) urged all responsible authorities in Universities and other Higher Educational Institutions to take necessary preemptive action and incorporate a zero-tolerance policy on unlawful ragging.

title: G2G medicine imports could collapse local industry: Associations warn
byline: Three local pharmaceutical industry associations have warned that the decision to import medicines from seven countries under the proposed Government-to-Government (G2G) import scheme threatens to collapse the local pharmaceutical industry.

title: Four more Sabaragamuwa undergrads arrested over ragging incident
byline: Four more students of the Sabaragamuwa University were arrested today by the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) over the ragging incident at the University, Police said.

title: CSE starts the week on a positive note as ASPI surpasses 15,900
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) concluded today’s trading session on a positive note, with the All Share Price Index (ASPI) closing above the 15,900 mark. The week started on an optimistic footing, supported by improved investor sentiment and renewed market confidence.

title: Court orders gold recovered from LTTE to be analysed by National Gem and Jewellery Authority
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today ordered that the gold items believed to have belonged to the LTTE and discovered in camps, illegal banks and buildings in the Northern and Eastern Provinces during the humanitarian operation, be handed over to the National Gem and Jewellery Authority for analysis and report.

title: NPP responds to controversial campaign songs circulated in North, East
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) refuted releasing Tamil-language campaign songs in the North and East, closely associated with Tamil nationalism and the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) as reported by some media.

title: Katunayake FTZ workers skip travel home to vote due to high bus fares
byline: Employees of the Katunayake Free Trade Zone (FTZ) are reportedly choosing to remain in their dormitories instead of travelling to their hometowns to vote in the Local Government elections tomorrow (6 May) due to the currently unaffordable bus fares.

title: Two flaws will defeat promised women’s quota in LG elections: Verité Research
byline: The 25% quota for women in local authority elections, introduced in 2017 to improve women’s representation, is likely to be defeated by two flaws in its implementation, Verité Research said.

title: Sri Lanka, Vietnam sign four MoUs, bilateral agreement on Customs affairs
byline: Sri Lanka and Vietnam signed four Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) and one Agreement in the presence of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and President of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, Luong Cuong.

title: Do not get exposed to intense heat in queues at polling stations
byline: Health authorities have warned the public to avoid exposing themselves to the intense heat affecting several areas of the country while waiting in queues at polling stations.

title: SJB complains to Election Commission against Prime Minister
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) lodged a complaint against Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya over a statement made by her asking her party supporters to campaign even during the silent period.

title: Mahesh Gammanpila taken back into remand custody
byline: Former Additional Secretary of the Ministry of Agriculture, Mahesh Gammanpila, who was released on bail today over allegations of causing a loss of over Rs. 13 million to the government by importing a shipment of organic fertilizer contaminated with harmful bacteria and pathogens, has been taken back into remand custody after failing to fulfill the conditions of his bail.

title: Complaint to CID against Tusitha Halloluwa over defamation of President
byline: A complaint has been lodged with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) against former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board Tusitha Halloluwa, over an allegedly defamatory and false statement made regarding President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.
